intro: Psychotria huampamiensis, commonly known as Huampami Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It often grows in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. Psychotria huampamiensis is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though research on its properties is limited.
